author: Special Correspondent
text:
Teachers affiliated to JACTO staging road roko agitation in front of the Collectorate in Salem on Sunday.- Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

The city police took into custody 192 teachers, including 32 women, affiliated to Joint Action Committee of Teachers Organisations (JACTO), when they attempted to stage a road block agitation in front of the Collectorate, here, for the second consecutive day on Sunday, to press their 15-point charter of demands.

The agitation was led by R. Murugesan, state president of the Teachers’ Association. P. Govindan, Salem district president of the Asiriyar Munnetra Sangam; Loganathan, district secretary; Gomathi of the women’s wing, and G. Murugesan, high level committee member of the JACTO, spoke highlighting their demands.

The protesting teachers were arrested and released in the evening.

The main demands of the teachers were doing away with the new pension policy and teachers eligibility test, extending all benefits announced for the teachers of the central government schools as per the recommendation of the Sixth Pay Commission for the teachers employed in state government schools.

The protest will be continued on Monday too, the JACTO sources said.

In Namakkal, a total of 531 JACTO members were rounded up in the town, when they staged a demonstration and attempted to block the park road in the morning.

S. Muthusamy, State general secretary of the Tamil Nadu Aasiriyar Koottani, led the agitation, police sources said.
title: Teachers stage protest
